availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT
I, THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH,
TO ALL SHERIFFS AND CONSTABLES IN SAID COMMONWEALTH, GREETING:

WHEREAS, It has been made known to me by Charles Anderson Governor of the state of Ohio that a certain George Maxwell of said State, stands indicted in the Montgomery County Court ^of Common Pleas^ Court for Murder in the first Degree a copy of which indictment, duly authenticated, is now on file in this Department; and that the said George Maxwell has fled from the State of Ohio, thereby evading the justice of its laws, and is going at large within the limits of the State of Kentucky.

Know Ye, Therefore, That I, THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE, Governor as aforesaid, do hereby require and enjoin all Sheriffs and Constables within this State to apprehend and arrest the said George Maxwell, and upon his apprehension, to proceed, by proper and legal testimony, to inquire into the matter, so far as shall be necessary, to ascertain the identity of the said George Maxwell and if he is the person mentioned in this, my warrant,, that the said Judge may order him to be delivered up to Swift Raper, who has been duly authorized by the Governor of the State of Ohio to receive and convey the said George Maxwell to the State of Ohio, to be dealt with according to law: And in case the said Swift Raper should not appear to receive him that the Judge may commit him, the said George Maxwell to jail, on the charge aforesaid, to be dealt with according to law: and that you report forthwith to the Governor of this Commonwealth your proceedings under this warrant. And furthermore, that if the said George Maxwell shall be committed to the jail of any county in this State, that the Judge so committing him may immediately inform the Governor of this Commonwealth of the commitment thereof, and to what jail he has been committed.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused the Seal of the Commonwealth to be affixed, at FRANKFORT, on the 26th day of Sept in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and 65 and in the 74th year of the Commonwealth.

BY THE GOVERNOR:
Richard T. Jacob
Lt. & Act. Gov.
E. L. VanWinkle, SECRETARY OF STATE,
By Jas R. Page
Asst Secty
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.

Executed September 28th 1865 by arresting George Maxwell and taking him before Judge L. W. Andrews. Judge of the 10th Judicial District of Kentucky at Flemingsburg Fleming County, Kentucky who remanded him to custody of Swift Roper, the within agent of Ohio.

Chas. B. Duke Dpty
for H. S. Jefferson S. M. C.
